number of helpful: 3 of 12 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
												First off, while I am recommending this product, I will definitely say it lacks quite a bit of polish that it desperately needs.While I do miss the more cartoony style of Fable: The Lost Chapters, Fable: Anniversary does well in the way of bringing us the hit-and-miss Fable 2 graphical style.I can't speak for keyboard users, as I use a PS3 controller with ScarletCrush and while the menus have gotten a bit more confusing, controller navigation is a breeze.Really, my only complaint with this game is the fact that it randomly stutters after an hour or so of play. Then it'll clear up for a while after about 15 minutes of choppiness. Then happen again later. I really hope they can and will fix that, as ♥♥♥♥♥♥ optimization is inexcusable in this day and age. Especially for something so recent.In short; Would recommend, but maybe wait a while before buying. And god help you if you're using a keyboard.EDIT #1: After some tweaking of graphics options, I find the stuttering to be much less of a problem. If you want to minimize performance impact, sent Anisotropic Filtering to Medium, and all LOD options to low, then restart your game. I found this to be extremely helpful, and it still looks better and has exceptionally better draw distance than The Lost Chapters.

number of helpful: 3 of 13 people (23%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16
												I have never played a Fable game in my life and it is my first time playing it. I think a person who had played the game in their childhood would greatly appreciate the remake, which is not my case.Gameplay wise, the controls are really clunky. I have tried both the keyboard and mouse combo and the Xbox 360 controller. The lock-on system is really frustating as it does not target the foe the camera is facing. When using the Xbox controller, there are too many emotes and spells to cycle through, which may be annoying during combat. I have only played a few hours, so maybe I have not become accustomed to the controls. Nonetheless, as a first time player, it is not enjoyable.Story wise, I cannot tell much about as I have not completed the game. From what I can tell, it is a rather simple story: *Spoilers* you control an orphaned kid throughout his journey to avenge the death of his parents. There are decisions to be made that will affect how people see you, either as a hero or a villain. That's pretty much what I understood from the few hours of gameplay.I can see why people like this game and I would have loved to finish it. But I really hate the controls. This is only my personal experience with the game and I am sure that many people had a much enjoyable experience.

number of helpful: 3 of 13 people (23%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												So I bought this game thinking it would look great and would blow me away with its visuals and new player models. Boy was I mistaken! So I booted up the game and I get to see all those old logos which was nice little bit of nostalgia but then the main menu shows up, and it's a book that opens up, everytime you launch the game. So you have to wait just a little but longer to even get into the menus/game. It's just tedious watching this damn book open everytime, just take me to the main menu please!Now the game looks a bit better to be honest. But it lacks the feeling of even being Fable at all. The characters all look weird now and don't have that charm they had from the previous version. All these old animations being used on newer looking models makes everyone just look awkward. But then there's you. You look like a train wreck! Someone ran over the heros face and now he looks like this weird, being of some sort that doesn't even look like he belongs in Fable. I couldn't get past it either. The Hero and The Guild Master just throw me off.Now the menus are just awful to navigate. It used to be you pressed pause and it would take you to a little menu that you could easily navigate through. It was simple and easy to get around in. Maybe a bit clunky but I had no problems with it. These new menus are trying to look all fancy and "current gen" but they somehow managed to make it complicated to figure out what's where. I got into my inventory and I was just so confused I couldn't tell what I was doing, and all I wanted was to equip my new weapon. Everything about this remaster of the classic is just too much if you ask me.The combat felt alright. I had no issues and infact felt like they had improved the AI some. Gameplay and all felt the same though and really felt alright. I was able to easily move around and do the side quests without any trouble. Don't take my review the wrong way it might not be all that bad but the visuals drove me away from this remake. Everything abouts new style really threw me off and not because I'm some nostalgia freak, but because it feels extremely unnatural, you can tell the quality in the cutscenes are lacking and the audio quality is a bit off (You can hear it clear as day if you compared the games) I don't recommend this game but instead, recommend you play the older one (Lost Chapters). However each is to their own so if this is the one you prefer then have at it! But I highly recommend you play the original!

content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
												This is about as good as it gets as far as re-skins are concerned. Don't expect the stuttering/repeating npc dialog, invisible walls in doorways and assorted other glitches we all remember to be patched though as this is NOT a reboot or overhaul, It is just a re-release with an all new graphics engine and it was never stated to be anything other than that, So the self righteous idiots whining about lion head not re-coding the entire game to fix minor non game breaking bugs just need to grow up and stop their ignorant whining because they never said they were going to in the first place. -This game works perfectly fine on my laptop so it's probably not the GAME that isn't working, I and many other laptop users are experiencing NO problems with this game so it may just be a glitch in the software or maybe even with steam that only affects towers.- What you see is what you get, The original fable digitally remastered with new HD graphics and textures and some new albeit minor in game content, The gameplay mechanics are the same and the controls are for the most part original in setup and the game runs very smoothly. FORTUNATELY Lionhead had the decency to make this game open source so Fable SHOULD recieve the patches that it needs before too long! This game is well worth a purchase if it's on sale.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2016
												I bought this for like 15 dollars on sale and I got to say, its worth 15 dollars but NOT worth 35. I beat fable 1 three times, the game itself is definitely worth the buy, but save your money and just get Fable the Lost Chapters. You are paying an extra 25 dollars for graphics that look like a refurbished ps2. THIS DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A PS3/XBOX 360 LEVEL GRAPHIC GAME. The graphics are still terrible, you still see floating feet, weird head bopping, no facial expressions, they put absolutely no effort into refurbishing these graphics.If you want a well made refurbished game, get something like Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD or Final Fantasy 7 HD. This one was done half azzed. (Stupid mature language filter.)Of course, this is Lions Gate we are talking about, their entire series was done half azzed. Even on console. That's why Microsoft expunged them. Don't get me wrong, 10 bucks for Fable the Lost Chapters is worth it and they make a very good story. They just dont bother fixing many of their glitches and tend to half azz it once the story is done.IN A SHORT VERSION: Save your money and only buy this for 15 dollars max. This is not a very well refurbished game, go buy Fable the Lost Chapters instead.PS: Don't let the play time fool you, I've beaten Fable 1, 2, and 3, and the only thing new was the graphics. Which was very sad. You can see several graphical glitches left behind that were common in old games very clearly. (Floating feet, blotchy noises, sunken eyes, etc.) Games like Final Fantasy Series made in HD,  Halo Master Chief Edition, Resident Evil Remakes, and practically every other remastered game fixed most of these graphical glitches, this is the only one i've played that hasn't bothered even trying, and looks like all they did was squench the pixels together. Which you can do yourself with Nvida Control Panel or whatever software thats equiped with your graphics card. Extremely disappointing. How this got so many good reviews, I dont even know. People truly are stupid. They dont realize they can just buy Fable the Lost Chapters and manually refurbish the graphics themselves.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												I'm sorry for the little time I invested in this, but the game was just unplayable... period. THIS REVIEW HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE STORY. I'm basing this on how I found the gameplay mechanics. There was A LOT of lag just in the introductory story. It took me a good couple of minutes to move from one house to another. Honestly, moving was the most awkward thing. I took a step, paused, took another step, paused. And maybe it was just me. I tried looking online to see what was wrong, but apparently it isn't me. A LOT OF PEOPLE HAVE HAD THIS PROBLEM IF YOU ACTUALLY LOOK IT UP! And there doesn't seem to be a solution to it or there might be but it requires you to do some complicated work apparently, which frankly, I do not have time for. Audio also didn't seem to match up with the CG cutscenes, and they too, were awkward. In one cutscene, I'm watching my character agonize over the death of their father but I'm also hearing gagging sounds and fighting noises in the background and it just doesn't match up whatsoever. I don't know.... couldn't kill to get a voice actor for your character as well to fill in the awkwardness? Idk... my character is freaking crying and I hear not a single sob. All I hear is, "Grrr! Gawww! Swish!" Like wth? xD Sorry but I just couldn't. I didn't care much for the graphics. Honestly, graphics looked terrible before I even bought this game but I do love story rich rpg games and it looked interesting so I got it anyway, which is why I was SO disappointed. I bet the game itself is splendid, but at this point, I'd rather watch a gameplay than actually play it. If you read reviews that say playing with a mouse and keyboard is terrible, they aren't lying. And playing with a controller doesn't make the gameplay better. Just saying. I've tried both methods. I know some ppl will judge me based on the time I spent, but it was hard to fully invest a lot of time in the game when I was having issues just doing basic functions. This review is simply what I experienced and possible a warning of what you might face because I am not the only one apparently who has had this issue. If you find your game working fine, I'm honestly really jealous. Lmao.

number of helpful: 23 of 59 people (39%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
												This is a remake of a previous Fable game.   Orignally designed by Peter Molyneux each playthrough can be different because people can do good or bad things.  Lots of awesome improvements from full controller support to an entirely new mode called "heroic mode".  Oddly keyboard and mouse support is missing, while it works in game they dont work in menus.  The classic God Game style of right or wrong is here, but no punishment for either, choose your path adventurer!  Lots of replay value since people can play the game through different ways, some classics never die.Classic style and graphics means nothing is lost.  This feels like the game they always wanted to make.  Voice acting is AMAZING, not many games made like this its a must for any fan of adventuring.Heroic mode tip from GarouxBloodline:  When playing in Heroic Mode, there is a way to continually get health potions.  In front of the Heroes Guild is a statue when it spins around facing the picnic area the health items respawn in the area, but only while the statue is facing the picnic area. First mission is the most important, probably pivotal to the core of the entire game which involves finding a bear to give your sister.  Devs are very active in the community which is nice because its easy to report a bug or anything else. (Though cheaper than a new full priced game, there is so much story that the value is higher than the store price.)Controller users:Rating:  9/10  Value:  $39.99Mouse/Keyboard Users: (Playable but lack of menu functionality makes it tough to navigate things.)Rating:  5/10  Value:  $9.99

number of helpful: 0 of 9 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												8.5/10A great remake of an awesome game. Not only that the models and textures got improved (some faces look pretty silly, though), it also has better lighting and full controller support.Everything else (the story, the soundtrack, the voices) remained the same and that's GOOD, otherwise it'd feel weird to play through this once again (if you ever played the original that is).Still, the all-new Heroic Mode makes this even more enjoyable: Tougher enemies, new enemy spawns (e.g. a Troll spawns at the Greatwood Lake right at the beginning of the game) and NO RESURRECTION PHIALS!The achievements are a neat little addition as well and add to the game's replay value (at least 2 are kind of missable, one being the Silver Key one, one depending on your playstyle).________________________________________________________________The sad thing is, this game's community is full of ungrateful brats who keep thinking that patches don't exist and who prefer to insult the developers instead of just telling what their problems are.A few bugs on launch day (Skyrim, Age of Empires II HD and a whole lot of other games had those, too) were enough for people to call this game a "dumb port", "huge failure" and "freaking disgrace".They even turned the full controller support (which they wanted for the old game) into a bad thing, just for the sake of complaining.Still, the devs keep providing updates and bug fixes (even unofficial ones).But don't say that in this game's Community Discussion or else you're called a troll or even "a member of the devs", because some people still pretend that nothing is getting fixed, that this game sucks and that the devs should "get cancer and die".Check some of the negative reviews for ease of reference.________________________________________________________________This doesn't influence my rating above, though. I enjoyed playing through this game again (and even twice, a good character in normal mode, an evil character in heroic mode).

content:
Posted: March 24
												Unbalanced nonsensical piece of garbage.3 Whole strenght based skill. Strenght (mediocre, pulled down by the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ melee system), Armor (useless), Health(at least worth something).3 Whole dexterity based skill. Guile=Charisma/Stealth (useless), speed (next to useless) accuracy (actually useful)A bunch of magical skills. Timeslow, Multistrike, Heal and Mana is useful. The rest are useless.All of them are from 1-7 except spells, which go from 1-4.There are two melee attacks, a regular, and a charged attack, which can only be executed at certain times. Ranged attacks have to be charged. Some spells like Fireball can be supercharged, which will make them more powerful.Ther are four XP types. General, Melee, Skill, Magic. Each XP can only be spent on its own skills, except General, which can be spent on anything. Melee XP comes from hitting stuff in melee, Skill XP comes from trading and shooting stuff with bows and crossbows, magic XP comes from casting spells (any spell, as long as it hits a valid target. Like Fireball anyone, Healing always gives xp, since you are a valid target). General XP only received on killing the target, or at certain quest reward points. All XP rewards subject to the combat multiplier, except for the quest rewards.Story (so far) bandits ransack your village, killing everyone, except you, your mother and sister. Apparently you are part of some sort of ancient bloodline, who can do stuff because reasons. Then each time you finish the quest, you get a DEUS EX FAKLOGIC level help to continue your epic quest to save your family. Then you get captured, and tortured, and you have to play this part because the developers are sociopaths. I mean ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ly attempt to create emotional vestment which they miserably failed just like in the previous ten or so hours. I mean... okay, I give up, there is literally no reason to play through your own torture. This is where I stopped.Overall, mediocre mechanics, FAKLOGIC level story, which actually pulls down this game into the "don't. just don't. Burn your disc. It's not even worth to be under your beerglass." category.

Overall, Fable Anniversary is an example of a good remastered game done right in my opinion. And yes, I have played the original Fable on the Xbox. I have also played Fable II and III.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 12
												So It's hard to rate this game honestly because today's standards for RPGs are so much greater than they were back when fable first came out, but I am going to rate it honestly by today's standards. I have also played the original and is probably one of my more favorite games for the xbox.Story:  5/10While the game is funny with a multitude of different side characters and side quests the game is overall short and does not immerse you well enough in to the world of fable. Since the story is short,  it makes everything seem to fly by, leaving  no real build up of characters and backstories, even though you can hear them briefly at the end of the game. The story does have it's twists, but at least to me, aren't super shocking and mind blowing.Gameplay/Combat: 4/5I do however enjoy the action combat. Nearly full control over what you can do, with no one type of combat (power,skill,will) feeling way overpowered, until maybe the last act of the game. The makers did very well in creating will powers that complement power and skill (personal favorite combo = slow time + multistrike + melee) making you not want to be purely a mage or warrior. This is an old game so sometimes targeting can be sketchy but overall a fun combat system.Replayability/Postgame:  0.5/2When you beat the game, you may have some sidequests leftover, but overall nothing extra once you are done. There is a little pull to create a new character and play the game in order to be the opposite of what you were the first time (good/evil) but its not really worth it.Graphics: 1.5/3This is an HD remake of the original so it the environment and characters do look nicer than it did in the original. However, it is not breaking any records and does not impress me to give it more than an average score.Music  0.5/2 - Not many tracks, Not really any standout tracks. Unique boss music? nope. Pretty much the music is there and the music fits the area you are in.Misc/Unique extras:  1.5/3Customization wise, I like that armor changes your appearance but the overall selection seems kind of small. There is no real benefit to wear cool or funny gear that you get because the armor values are much lower than the warrior plate armor, while at the same time the plate armor does not dull your mage abilities. The game being funny is definitely a bonus. I still like Fable's unique experience system (general/skill/will/power) where basically you get general experience and then bonus experience for whatever fighting style you did that battle. The new "hard mode" is another new pull that can get the hardcore gamers a little more challenge.Overall 13/25The problem really is the story has not held up over the years, and this is an rpg meaning the game score should be heavily weighted towards the story and that's what I did.  Gameplay is still solid by today's standards and should not be overlooked. based on the score  this game hardly gets a thumbs up but I' would give it a thumbs up because it is a game worth playing especially for nostalgia purposes. This game also played a big role in RPGs, helping lead the way to more decision based RPG games.

												There's a lot of negative reviews for this game, and rightly so from when it first launched.  I wanted to share my experience with the game as of 2016/02/23.  Windows 10, 32GB, nVidia GTX 970, drivers v361.91.In short:  through 51 hours of playtime I suffered one crash.  There were no UI or usability issues except for one. I enjoyed the game tremendously.If you enjoy Fable I recommend this game to you.

content:
Posted: March 10
												Wished that Fables 2 because, with a game as good as Fable Anniversary, players like me will want MORE Fable! Fable 3 was out, but Valve apparently took it down years back. A shame! That's all in the past now. On to the Pros and Cons we go![Pros]*Texture is 8/10. Have not played the original Fable, or Fable: The Lost Chapters, but I must say that the rich textures put this game on par with Fable 3. Well done, Lionhead Studios!*Storyline is 4/5! Chicken difficulty is kinda misleading. As you level up, the enemies get tougher. So, it is no shame to play on Chicken difficulty. Heck, I'm currently playing on that difficulty, and I'm loving it!*Though I have not yet finished the game, the length of the game so far is, to say the least, reasonable. I'd recommend to those new to Fable games to play at their own pace, and not rush!*Kudos to the members of Lionhead Studios who added in famous KFC line "Finger-lickin' good"; that was both brilliant and hilarious!*Tip to making easy coin when not doing a quest (be it a gold, silver, or bronze quest), are the Game Masters. Black Jack is my favorite, because it is not timed! Save after each win, though, because a loss can be quite aweful if ever you choose to double the bet.[Cons]*Unlike Fable 3, your character and his wifey cannot have a child! What about adopting? Negatory on that. It's like the prince of Fable 3 is not related to the Hero of Fable Anniversary! Earth to Lionhead Studios; Hero x Woman + Sex = Next Hero!*Fable Anniversary? Sounds like a bundle for the Fable games. Why, oh Lionhead, did you not make Fable 2 and 3 compatible with PC? Fable Anniversary could've been used as a label for a bundle containing Fables 1-3! Oh well!Is this game worth the price? On sale? It's worth it either way, but I must recommend getting it when it goes on sale! Who knows? There may be another awesome game on Steam! Anyways. I hope this review helps you in deciding on whether you want this game or not! Peace out, y'all!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
												There has only ever been two games in existence that I have stated are "the best game of all time" and the original Fable held the title for years. With that being said, quite obviously, seeing the "HD" remake finally come to PC deserved more than my attention.I understood that no mere remake would ever come close to the experience I had when playing the original, nor did I expect this anniversary edition to be held to such a high standard. What I did expect however was to go on a glorified nostalgia trip and bellow in the good times of yonder and upon release, I did not think this game could offer that due to the sheer amount of bugs and crashes that occured, jest I forget the bloody awful blur that was everywhere, but a few patches later, it is absolutely worthy of merit. There are however, some gripes which still have not been "fixed".A PC game should use a mouse and keyboard apppropriately in whichever way makes it easier for the user. Good PC ports understand this simple concept and use both inputs as intended, however, poor ports which have clearly been rushed out and unpolished do not and often retain keyboard controls where they should not be. Sadly, Fable Anniversary is the latter. No mouse controls in menus whatsoever is frustrating beyond comprehension and should never occur. It still makes me wonder how when the game was originally released, it can pass quality control, not only by Lionheads testers, but by this distrubution service. It should not be legal to advertise and sell a product as a polished fully-working release when this is quite clearly not that. It is truly sadenning to see how poorly Lionhead Studios performs since Molyneux's depart and the fact this thing was released in such a state shows an utter lack of respect for the PC audience as a whole. Of course, as previously mentioned, the majority of gripes have been fixed now, but the release sure was off-putting.Graphically, it does overall look quite pleasing. The environments are relatable to the original and look most grand. The models however, espescially the hero, look laughable and plastic.The "Heroic Mode", which was advertised as an extremely hard mode, was really not noticable. Apart from the lack of resserection phails (lives), the game was overall quite forgiving in both combat and items. I never truly felt challenged and I believe I only died once overall, which, considering I'm so bad at games in general, should say it all. I had a lot of fun with the achievements, even if one of them was bugged and I had to do the whole bloody thing all over again (silver keys are so unrad). Overall, it's quite easy no matter which mode you're on, now the bugs have been patched, it's quite a nice nostalgia trip to the original and I would recommend it to not only original Fable fans, but to people who never got around to playing the original and want to give it a shot in HD glory.

content:
Posted: March 10
												Fable Anniversary enhances the original with better graphics and visuals. As a fan of the original Fable back in 2005, this version of the game still holds it's charm. It's difficult to write a review without nostalgia getting in the way but, in my own opinions heres what I have to say about this game.If you have never played a Fable game before, there is no better game to start the series off with than by playing the first one. If you enjoy decision making elements in rpgs than this is your game. The story and music is excellent as well as has a good sense of humor. You will be solving riddles and completing side quests that build your characters alignment (good or evil). Fighting all sorts of humans and creatures on the way using mele, range, or magic. Depending on what paths to take is all up to you.Don't keep standing there like a lemon and buy this game already! :P

content:
Posted: November 30, 2015
												I remember when this first came out there were Mixed reviews and I was heartbroken to see that Fable Anniversary wasnt  the port everyone wanted it to be. Fast forward one year, I have purchased the game on sale and I can gladly say, the port works amazingly. I will say that by default, the graphics and color palette are bland. I strongly recommend you look up Sweet Fx presets so that you can really feel that Fable 'Fantasy' mood again. Once you have that installed, it felt so compelling to play the game once more. The textures are a nice facelift and it feels even better to play a simple RPG since nowadays in 2015 all the RPG's are insansely huge. If you are a hardcore Fable fan, I would recommend you look into the Sweet FX visual presets and you should feel right at home with this 2005 classic as it plays just as good with some minor annoyances.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 8, 2015
												I feel like, after having played Fable on Xbox as a child, and now the Anniversary edition on PC, I am good to leave a short review. Please keep in mind I played the game using an Xbox 360 controller, which makes things such as the UI and all the menus relatively easy for me to use and I have therefore had no trouble with the PC porting.The first thing I noticed when I started the game was the graphics overhaul. While the characters in game where not the prettiest in the old Fable, the overhauled characters topped the being ugly by far. It's great they tried making the faces look more "real", but the people look more like trolls than people to me. I love how the difficulty of Fable is rather low, so even idiots like me can play and finish the game, even without dying once. The addition of the Heroic difficulty is a nice addition for players that pack more of a punch than I do. Luckily, there is plenty of possibility to grind, if you have the patience.I have personally not noticed any bugs and glitches that bothered me during the game, except for one exploit which I used to obtain an otherwise unobtainable silver key. During my play-through, the game only crashed once, which is acceptable, considering some of the games in my library crash every 25 minutes.Overall, for those of your playing with a controller, this game should be no trouble at all to play. For those using their mouses and keyboards, if you can manage to look through the bad porting, well, you may enjoy it as much as I have.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 1, 2015
Not quite what I anticipated.Fable is a wonderful game, and is one of my favorite games as a child. I played through it several times, clocking in many hours of this game. I love this game, I really do.That being said, it breaks my heart that Fable Anniversary is a poorly done port of the original. The only real improvement in this game was the visuals. However those visuals weren't as dolled up as I had previously hoped; the only real improvements to Fable Anniversary is that it has a new coat of paint.That is seriously it; a fresh, albeit sloppy, paint job. No new movement animation for cutscenes, fights, gameplay, or anything. While I'm not saying this is a bad thing, I'm really upset how they didn't bother improving anything else; because Fable was kind of ugly. They had so much room for improvements, but they barely did a damn thing.The menus are rediculously hard to maneuver through, and honestly look worse than in the original Fable. The new UI is.. okay; nothing really exciting, but everything is where it was before..I love this game, and I will not stop playing it; just because I was dissapointed severly with Fable Anniversary.I would not recommend anyone buy this remake at full price. Ever. I bought it on sale; so I would tell you to do the same.Or you could always buy the original Fable: The Lost Chapter for a third of Anniversary's pricetag. Unless, that is, you care for Achievements and muh Trading Cards.

												Full disclosure: I didn’t play the original Fable when it first came out, so I can’t compare the two.Fable Anniversary is a solid third-person RPG; not a great game by any means but not a bad one either. The controls are a little clunky and the story is fairly uninspired. That being said, this game will certainly keep you entertained for close to twenty hours, longer if you make a real attempt to find all the secrets. Worth picking up if you’re looking for a basic RPG experience.

												If you like classic rpg with good and evil paths, multiple play styles, and still plays well on computer you will enjoy this game. content:
Posted: March 23, 2016
												HOT, BUTTERY BITTER-SWEET NOSTALGIAWhat can any of us ay about a game that has impacted countless games after it?I doubt very much, but here I shall try....Fable Anniversary takes the iconic classic first entry in the brilliant Fable series and glosses it up in high-res sugary anthrax. What do I mean by that? That the game still does so very much right (great story, decent depth, and a combat system that won't leave you throwing the controller too often), but it falls short when compared to the many titles that have built upon its great foundation.That being said, I higly recommend this game to anyone that hasn't ever played it, and even a good bit of those who did, and loved it, hated it, and couldn't put it down....

content:
Posted: April 7, 2016
												Fable Anniversary is a game that was marketed to be the best thing since Fable: The Lost Chapters. The game itsself is indeed a remake of the original but it seems as though they focused more on making it look up to date instead of fixing the painful small bugs that existed in the original and TLC.I bought this game instead of the original because this one has controller support - and as someone who played the original on the Xbox, this is a must.Pros: Controller support Higher resolution textures than original NostalgiaCons: They really butchered the menu Some bugs are still present from the original The main menu takes ages to open the damn book (really, why!?) The cutscenes still look like 1980All in all, I would not recomend this game to people who liked the original Fable and intend to buy this for nostalgia (unless the nostalgia is strong enough to weigh two points against the cons list). New players to Fable should get this one though. It has better quality textures and the story is exactly the same.6/10 would probably recommend depending on nostalgia levels.

content:
Posted: January 27
												Maybe this is a good game. However for me, it is not playable.There're 2 reasons which drive me away from Fable Anniversary:First, playing this game with keyboard and mouse felt uncomfortable. Clunkier than I thought it would be.So, I plugged in my controller and tried it again. However it only made my experience worse. Here's the second reason:Everytime I pulled or pushed my left stick to order my character to do a 180 degree turn, the camera shaked for 1.5 second. And this kind of camera shaking was something that I had never seen before. It shaked in a strange frequency and made me feel really dizzy. After just one minute game play with the controller, I had to quit the game because if I didn't do that, I would have a bad headache, literally. I don't know if anyone else has the same problem. However to me, this game is not playable with either keyboard & mouse, or a controller.So, yeah, I have to give it a thumb-down.PS: I know some people may argue, but turning back means turning 180 degree, not 360 degree. Turning 360 degree means making a circle and your eyes will still be looking at the same direction. If you have a mechanical clock just look at its arms and imagine they are representing the direction of your line of sight, and you will understand.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												If only there was a more middle of the road button. D:Anyway, I'll say this much-- I haven't run into all the same glitches everyone else has reported yet, and some of them are quite the same as what Fable had prior to remodeling. It's an overrated version of the original, which is why I only bought it when on sale. I give credit where credit is due; it does look somewhat nicer than it was (Read: They cut corners), but I guess I'm a bit harsh when it comes to game aesthetics. Also let's be realistic here; the game itself is still good content-wise. If the glitches happen to hinder your ability to play it, then go back to the original copy if you've got one floating around. The only bad bug I encountered so far is that the voices tend to cut out randomly. With subtitles, I can live with that.Bottom line is, its still Fable. Its still buggy-yet-easy as ever, it's still basically the game so many know and love. Could it have been redone better? Absolutely. But evidently, this is what we're getting. Here's to hoping they decide to clean it up a bit more.Meanwhile, I'll continue playing it on and off until more glitches annoy the living hell out of me. :3

content:
Posted: January 8, 2016
												This game is one of my all time favorite games and probably my favorite RPG game.Fable is so immersive and sucks you in with its charm and vast dialogue, personally I think this is the pinnacle of a solo RPG game and the best of the Fable franchise.I could write alot about this game but to try keep it short; if you enjoy fantasy games and want a indulgent campaign to play through it is a must buy, it is one of few games that I have genuinly been dissapointed to have finished everything on and have no more reason to play.I would suggest playing it through on the harder difficulty (introduced by the Anniversary edition) and also take your time with the story and complete all the side quests along the way to make sure you get your times worth as there is unfortunatley little end game content.But overall this game for me is pure enjoyment although that may be partly to blame on the nostalgia from my first play through on Xbox Classic.

												This is far from a remake. Whilst playing the visuals were far less pleasing than what I expected. Anything far away is blurred beyond recognition and my screen tore what I was seeing unless I turned V-sync on which limits you to 60fps. And don’t get me started on the horrible UI in the menu. I would reccomend 'Fable: The Lost Chapters' over this version. However if you are not to fussy about the things I've mentioned it is quite playable with a controller. Would highly reccomend getting it if you wish to buy this game.

												Full disclosure: I didn’t play the original Fable when it first came out, so I can’t compare the two.Fable Anniversary is a solid third-person RPG; not a great game by any means but not a bad one either. The controls are a little clunky and the story is fairly uninspired. That being said, this game will certainly keep you entertained for close to twenty hours, longer if you make a real attempt to find all the secrets. Worth picking up if you’re looking for a basic RPG experience.

Posted: April 7, 2016
												Fable Anniversary is a game that was marketed to be the best thing since Fable: The Lost Chapters. The game itsself is indeed a remake of the original but it seems as though they focused more on making it look up to date instead of fixing the painful small bugs that existed in the original and TLC.I bought this game instead of the original because this one has controller support - and as someone who played the original on the Xbox, this is a must.Pros: Controller support Higher resolution textures than original NostalgiaCons: They really butchered the menu Some bugs are still present from the original The main menu takes ages to open the damn book (really, why!?) The cutscenes still look like 1980All in all, I would not recomend this game to people who liked the original Fable and intend to buy this for nostalgia (unless the nostalgia is strong enough to weigh two points against the cons list). New players to Fable should get this one though. It has better quality textures and the story is exactly the same.6/10 would probably recommend depending on nostalgia levels.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 26
												Fable was one of my favourite RPG games on PC when it was first released in 2004. The story is gripping, the graphics is certianly much more polished and the sound effect is for sure much better compared to 2004 version. Fable has aged well, partly because some of its best ideas have since become action-RPG staples - things like real-time combat, good-evil alignment and a world that reacts to your actions. Fable didn’t invent any of these things, but it does them well and uniquely enough that it’s still fun to play today.Fable has aged well, partly because some of its best ideas have since become action-RPG staples - things like real-time combat, good-evil alignment and a world that reacts to your actions. Fable didn’t invent any of these things, but it does them well and uniquely enough that it’s still fun to play today. It’s easy to feel at home in this fantastical version of England’s green and pleasant land, where the countryside goes on forever and nobody is from inside the M25, and you’re greeted by cheers and applauding admirers whenever you step into the village pub for a pint. The place feels alive.Fable is a simple and recognisable heroic tale at heart - you go from young boy to storied warrior, leaving your mark on the land of Albion, and eventually avenging your family - but the setting and sense of humour make it much more endearing than the usual po-faced videogame fantasy. The strange thing about Fable is that for all the choice it offers, there’s very little consequence. You can get married, but after that you can run off for literally years and leave your wife or husband alone and they don’t seem to mind. You can murder shopkeepers, but everyone soon forgets about it. Its morality is very simplistic and unsubtle by modern standards. This makes it feel rather shallow, but it also enables you to be playful with its morality, if the mood takes you.Fable Anniversary hasn't added much to the original just save achievements and a harder 'Heroic Mode'. Updated graphics, improved controls, and a new save system.If you enjoyed Fable, you will sure like this version

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 12
												So It's hard to rate this game honestly because today's standards for RPGs are so much greater than they were back when fable first came out, but I am going to rate it honestly by today's standards. I have also played the original and is probably one of my more favorite games for the xbox.Story:  5/10While the game is funny with a multitude of different side characters and side quests the game is overall short and does not immerse you well enough in to the world of fable. Since the story is short,  it makes everything seem to fly by, leaving  no real build up of characters and backstories, even though you can hear them briefly at the end of the game. The story does have it's twists, but at least to me, aren't super shocking and mind blowing.Gameplay/Combat: 4/5I do however enjoy the action combat. Nearly full control over what you can do, with no one type of combat (power,skill,will) feeling way overpowered, until maybe the last act of the game. The makers did very well in creating will powers that complement power and skill (personal favorite combo = slow time + multistrike + melee) making you not want to be purely a mage or warrior. This is an old game so sometimes targeting can be sketchy but overall a fun combat system.Replayability/Postgame:  0.5/2When you beat the game, you may have some sidequests leftover, but overall nothing extra once you are done. There is a little pull to create a new character and play the game in order to be the opposite of what you were the first time (good/evil) but its not really worth it.Graphics: 1.5/3This is an HD remake of the original so it the environment and characters do look nicer than it did in the original. However, it is not breaking any records and does not impress me to give it more than an average score.Music  0.5/2 - Not many tracks, Not really any standout tracks. Unique boss music? nope. Pretty much the music is there and the music fits the area you are in.Misc/Unique extras:  1.5/3Customization wise, I like that armor changes your appearance but the overall selection seems kind of small. There is no real benefit to wear cool or funny gear that you get because the armor values are much lower than the warrior plate armor, while at the same time the plate armor does not dull your mage abilities. The game being funny is definitely a bonus. I still like Fable's unique experience system (general/skill/will/power) where basically you get general experience and then bonus experience for whatever fighting style you did that battle. The new "hard mode" is another new pull that can get the hardcore gamers a little more challenge.Overall 13/25The problem really is the story has not held up over the years, and this is an rpg meaning the game score should be heavily weighted towards the story and that's what I did.  Gameplay is still solid by today's standards and should not be overlooked. based on the score  this game hardly gets a thumbs up but I' would give it a thumbs up because it is a game worth playing especially for nostalgia purposes. This game also played a big role in RPGs, helping lead the way to more decision based RPG games.

Great game returns in a new guise, but with the old content.You will find yourself in a Kingdom called Albion and will go from a young boy with a heart full of revenge to the great Hero (with a capital letter). On your way to face many dangers, for which you were trained from an early age. I think many people played the original Fable and know what it's about.This HD re-release also includes the addition of "Lost Chapter". In the game interface and graphics are much improved. Clumsy release control with the X-box can still be felt, but fortunately, everything can be customized to your choice. Colour is good. however, the only thing that gets in the way is a huge number of downloads of locations with extremely small area. The linearity of these locations is attached. And so, it's the same good old Fable.The game can be purchased for the sake of the ability to kick chickens =)In General, the game is wonderful. There's a storyline with twists and additional tasks with complications. And humor is present.10 peasants frightened by the beard of the player from 10.

												Alrighty,Here is my fully honest review of this game. I have played the original Fable.. well, a lot, I've beat the game several times.The first thing I will say, is that this game is almost if not, Exactly the same. The biggest difference is the graphics. The menu system is different/better-ish. I got this really cheap from King. I wouldn't suggest full price. Just like the newer Fable games, 2, 3... I never got deep into playing those games.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												It's been nearly 10 years since I played the Xbox original, and recently my wife and I played through Fable 2 and 3, giving me the strength to pick this game up as soon as it went on sale.I forgot how good this game was! Definitely the best of the trilogy as it's the most solid and consistent when it comes to any aspect of the game. The story is light-hearted with some attempts at being dark, but it keeps the game going and that's good enough. Quests are plentiful and varied (well there aren't THAT many to do, but they're all worth doing and can make for some memorable gaming moments.I guess the charm of Fable is how simple it all is; the combat, story, world... it's just compact and neat, and makes for a nice little game that's worth at least a playthrough. No need to worry about armor stats, level/class restrictions, weaknesses and effective attacks; just play the game and have fun.There's some choice-making in the game (to do with the story line) but it's not the most connsequential system and, for the people with a lot of time on their hands, a good excuse to replay the game a few more times.Anyway, it's a simple RPG from England and possibly the studio's best piece of work. Looks gorgeous today, especially in 4K, and is just plain and simple fun.
